extends Component

      • getState

        public String getState(Interaction context,
                       org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                       GuiPoint cursor)
        Description copied from class: Component
        Gets the current state of the component for the given parameters. This methods main purpose is to allow caching and reduce the need to render and send data. This method can be executed very frequently (by default every 50ms for every interacting player) so don't do any heavy calculations here.
        If Component.apply(Graphics, Interaction, Player, GuiPoint) renders different content, then the this method should return different strings. If it renders the same the return value should be the same.
        A good way to achieve this is to just 'describe' what you would render. (e.g. the RectComponent returns x+"*"+y+"*"+width+"*"+height+"*"+color.getRGB())
        Specified by:
        getState in class Component
        Parameters:
        context - the context
        player - the player
        cursor - the cursor
        Returns:
        the state
